remarks.p: The HTTP response is expected to be in the following format:

The Name (e.g., "module") and Abbreviation (e.g., "md") of the database appear in the left column, and the Title, Version, and Organization appear in the right column. These tokens are always present. Name and Abbreviation may be the same for some databases, especially composite databases like LigandDb or GenomesDb. For individual KEGG databases, there is usually only one number-of-entries line, without a database name. Composite databases, however, typically have multiple lines, with one line per auxiliary database.
For example, here is the response returned by "http://rest.kegg.jp/info/genomes":

code.title: KEGG Info Response for GENOMES Database

remarks.code: genomes KEGG Genomes Database gn Release 81.0+/03-16, Mar 17 Kanehisa Laboratories genome 5,038 entries egenome entries mgenome 1,189 entries
